page.title: 02Landscape in Bristol
page.content: The banks of the waters are covered in rock slides and trees. Close by is { {Ashton Court Estate,}owned by Bristol Corporation. There are many activities which you can enjoy such as grass skiing, golf, horse-riding, funfairs, etc. Coming from the bottom of Ashton Court and by following the river it will take you to {Bristol {Temple Meads Station}where you can catch a train, which is a means of transport, from Bristol to London and many other places is England. Coming back down the River Avon, past the New Cut across the Plimsoll Bridge, you come to the Cumberland Basin. It can only be entered by ships when the tide has come in. The bridge above swings open to let ships through. The bridge, called the {Plimsoll Bridge } was named after the man who designed the Plimsoll Line.
